_header: As in my remembrance none but ye alone
Subjects: lovers, absence/separation of; lovers’ lament; complaints, lovers’
_description: To his mistress — two stanzas rhyme royal.

CULFf16.First Lines:
As in my remembrauns non but ye a loneWiche me causithe bothe to
                    sygh and playneI haue no comfort wher schall y make my moneso for from
                    you that is all my payne…
CULFf16.Last Lines:
…When y thing on you and am absentffor alas departyng hath my
                    hert schent
CULFf16.Facsimiles:
Beadle,  Richard,  and  Alfred E. B. Owen.  
             The Findern Manuscript: Cambridge University Library MS. F.1.6.
         London: Scolar Press, 1977.
